comments.author: EXMON
comments.body: Quote from: dbc23 on November 28, 2022, 08:31:52 PMA level up society is what the social Media has reduced human kind to. Social Media has made everyone eager to impress. Users go has far has using borrowed clothes, shoes, jewelries, bags, cars and other accessories to impress the public who only view, like and comment on their accounts.Fake life comes with depression one thing many tend to ignore. Fake life is even more expensive than the real life itself because on might be tempted to use their last fund to get things the will show the world who careless about how the feel. Social Media has also worsened the desperation for Richies. No more morals, no etiquette everything is now a lifestyle as long as it entices our selfish desires and lust. I completely agree with you. Social media has created a culture of competition where people feel the need to keep up with each other. It's not just about sharing moments of our lives, but also about presenting ourselves in the best possible light. This has led to a situation where people feel pressured to create a fake image of themselves and to try to impress others.One of the most worrying things about social media is the impact it has on our mental health. Many people feel anxious or depressed when they don't receive enough likes or comments on their posts. This can lead to a vicious cycle where people feel the need to create even more impressive content to gain attention, which in turn leads to even more pressure and anxiety.Moreover, this culture of competition has led people to become more materialistic, and it has become more difficult to distinguish between what is genuine and what is not. In the past, people were more focused on building meaningful relationships with others and making memories, but now, it's all about the appearance of success and popularity.What we need to remember is that social media is just a tool, and it should be used in a positive way. We need to be aware of the negative impact that it can have on our mental health and our relationships. We should use it to connect with others, share our experiences, and spread positivity, rather than trying to compete with each other or present a fake image of ourselves.What do you think about this? Have you experienced any negative impacts of social media on your life?
